  • Curse and Earthquake: Ghost Curse unfortunately does not work against Gholdengo, so using regular Curse alongside Earthquake makes Garganacl far less passive against against Gholdengo and frail Substitute users such as Flutter Mane. This is especially recommended if using other Tera types.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - High: Salt Cure means Garganacl can still without Terastallization, but to truly take advantage of either facet of Curse, expect to Terastallize it often.

  • Ghost: In addition to being a great defensive typing that leaves Garganacl with only a weakness to Dark thanks to Purifying Salt, this is the Tera type that enables the unique properties of Curse.

  • Water: If messing with Gholdengo is the goal, Tera Water is an excellent choice, resisting the powerful Make It Rain and being a good defensive typing in general.

  • Steel: Tera Steel works very well against Flutter Mane and makes for a Make It Rain resistance against Gholdengo. However, retaining the Ground and Fighting weaknesses means it doesn't change as many matchups as other Tera types.

  • Flying: Tera Flying has excellent synergy with Garganacl's former typing, making it immune to Ting-Lu and Dondozo's Fissure and giving it a much better matchup against Meowscarada and Great Tusk. However, this comes at the cost of still making it vulnerable to Iron Bundle.

Armarouge.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Expanding Force
sets.description:
• Armarouge's combination of powerful STAB moves, excellent coverage, Weak Armor, and Psychic Terrain makes it a strong candidate to use Focus Sash.

  • Psychic Terrain: Psychic Terrain is a powerful setup move for Armarouge thanks to Expanding Force; it also protects Armarouge from priority moves after Weak Armor triggers.

  • Expanding Force: Expanding Force under Psychic Terrain especially with Tera Psychic, is a devastatingly powerful move.

  • Armor Cannon: This helps Armarouge defeat Steel-types as well as Chien-Pao and Wo-Chien, who all resist or block Expanding Force.

  • Aura Sphere: While Armor Cannon covers several prominent Dark-types, Aura Sphere is needed if you want to threaten Chi-Yu or Roaring Moon.

  • Destiny Bond: This is a good alternative to forcefully take down threats that Armarouge can’t easily KO, and it works very well with Weak Armor.

  • Energy Ball: Energy Ball hits the specially defensive Water-types Armarouge might struggle to defeat otherwise, most notably Gastrodon.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Between Focus Sash and Psychic Terrain blocking priority moves, Armarouge is well-equipped to play without Tera. On the other hand, Armarouge can specialize to handle certain matchups better, at which point Tera can become more necessary.

  • Grass: This Tera typing turns Armarouge's Water- and Ground-type weaknesses into resistances, and gives a vital Spore immunity against opposing Breloom.

  • Psychic: With a boost from Tera Psychic, Expanding Force OHKOes even relatively bulky foes such as Garchomp and Flutter Mane. With Stealth Rock, Expanding Force still achieves most notable KOs without Tera Psychic, but the extra damage is still appreciated.

  • Fairy: In cases where setting up Psychic Terrain proves to be more difficult, Tera Fairy grants a resistance to Sucker Punch and makes disrupting other Dark-types like Chi-Yu easier. Its also just a solid defensive typing that neutralizes all of its other weaknesses.

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting is a more niche option for a Dark-type resistance that also powers up Aura Sphere.

Abilities

  • Weak Armor: This ability takes full advantage of Focus Sash, guaranteeing you live a single hit from a physical attacker and granting a big Speed boost thereafter.

  • Flash Fire: While more situational, Flash Fire is worth considering with certain Tera Types like Grass, keeping momentum against revenge killers who use Fire-type attacks. It can also be used with Tera Fairy or Tera Fighting to shut down many variants of Chi-Yu.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Ceruledge.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Bulk Up Sweeper
sets.description:
• Bulk Up Ceruledge makes excellent use of both its respectable bulk and Bitter Blade's high recovery. By changing its typing to a more defense oriented one, while maintaining the Fire immunity thanks to Flash Fire, Ceruledge can set up Bulk Ups on a variety of common Pokemon, ranging from Corviknight, Kingambit, Azumarill and Gholdengo.

  • Taunt: Taunt lets Ceruledge set up Bulk Up without needing to fear common phasing moves (with the exception of attacking moves such as Dragon Tail), as well as opposing setup moves such opposing Bulk Up and Iron Defense, provided you outspeed.

  • Shadow Sneak Priority of some form is always nice to have on a Pokemon, which makes Shadow Sneak an easy contender for the last move. Gaining extra added strength against Pokemon such as Flutter Mane, Dragapult and Annihilape is certainly charming.

  • Grass Tera Blast: This allows Ceruledge to eliminate Dondozo more quickly. While Taunt can shut down Dondozo's Yawn, it cannot shut down Fissure. The only way to beat Dondozo would be to eliminate it as quickly as possibly, which Grass Tera Blast aids with.

  • Flame Charge: Flame Charge provides Ceruledge an extra net of safety against potential Scarf users and Annihilape, who are capable of turning the tides against it. While normally, Ceruledge is prone to faster Taunt + Bulk Up users and Scarfed Trick, Flame Charge helps mitigate both of those weaknesses.

  • Will-O-Wisp: Ceruledge can be a status spreader in games where it can't set up as easily. It also helps Ceruledge set up more easily against threats such as Unaware Clodsire.

Tera Types

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy helps Ceruledge's matchup against prominent Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Grass: An immunity to Spore and a resistance to Water makes Grass the most notable Tera type for this set. Flash Fire eliminating one of Grass's many weaknesses is also noteworthy.

  • Fire: Increasing Bitter Blade's power will always be a valuable trait. Eliminating Ghost's weaknesses to Ghost and Dark also allows Ceruledge to set up more comfortably.

  • Bug: Tera Bug is similar to Tera Grass, but in exchange for losing the Water resistance and maintaining the Rock weakness of Fire / Ghost, Ceruledge can tank Volcarona's Bug Buzz with significantly more ease.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def with Impish: Investing into Defense prepares Ceruledge and its mediocre physical bulk for the physical-biased metagame. Bulk Up will boost its Defense, but it can struggle to take some physical hits even after a boost, and its special bulk is naturally high.

  • 252 HP / 252 Spe with Jolly: A faster spread helps Ceruledge outspeed other Bulk Up users, like Annihilape opting to invest in bulk. Being faster, more often than not, lets Ceruledge win these matchups with ease.

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD with Careful: While most threats in the metagame at the moment are physical, a specially defensive spread is still noteworthy for its ability to surprise Hydreigon.

sets.name: Focus Sash Attacker
sets.description:
• With a stellar offensive typing, a unique set of attacks, Weak Armor allowing it to outspeed a large part of the metagame, and its immunity to Extreme Speed and Mach Punch, Ceruledge proves itself to be a very solid Focus Sash option.

  • Bitter Blade: Bitter Blade's recovery can make Focus Sash usable even if entry hazards chip it. If Ceruledge is brought down to 1 HP, a +2 Bitter Blade can heal it to the point that it can tank an extra attack.

  • Close Combat versus Shadow Claw: Close Combat hits the Normal-, Dark-, and Rock-types that resist Ceruledge's STAB combination. Still, Shadow Claw is a noteworthy choice to guarantee the KO on Mimikyu and let Ceruledge pressure Skeledirge. Note, however, that maximum Defense Skeledirge can recover more than Shadow Claw's damage, barring critical hits, and a Terastallized Skeledirge can completely wall this set.

  • Swords Dance versus Destiny Bond: As powerful as Swords Dance boosted attacks from Ceruledge are, the abundance of Unaware Pokemon, primarily Dondozo, has made some players opt to use Destiny Bond to snag surprise kills. Destiny Bond can also make the matchup against KOing common Sucker Punch Pokemon, such as Meowscarada and Kingambit, easier to win without having to rely on predictions.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: Adamant's added damage output is valuable, but Jolly allows Ceruledge to outspeed non-Scarf Gholdengo, and gives it a chance at outspeeding Modest Rotom formes and Glimmora. All of the mentioned examples are Special Attackers, meaning Ceruledge's Weak Armor often does not trigger in these matchups.

Tera Types

  • Fire: Giving Bitter Blade an extra push in damage is quite useful, giving Ceruledge more recovery.

  • Normal: Normal is an exceedingly common Tera Type on Ghost types due to the immunity it brings to the table. Ceruledge makes particularly excellent use of Normal Tera by resisting both Steel and Fairy, making it very difficult for Gholdengo and Mimikyu to click anything other than a Ghost type move when facing off against Ceruledge.

  • Fighting: Giving extra reach pwer to Close Combat, a powerful option against Pokemon such as Hydreigon, makes Fighting a solid choice for a Tera Type.

Bellibolt.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Tactical Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt can be quite unassuming, and specially offensive Pokemon such as Hydreigon and Rotom may see it as a free opportunity to get into position. Assault Vest turns the tides against them with Electromorphosis + Parabolic Charge, which makes Bellibolt seem impossible to remove for certain Pokemon. It's also a decent check against Iron Bundle.

  • Grass- or Fairy-type Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important coverage to have; with a Fairy Tera type, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragon-types.

  • Muddy Water versus Chilling Water: Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric for much-needed coverage. Alternatively, Chilling Water weakens common switch-ins such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur, allowing you to reposition your team more safely.

  • Acid Spray: This threatens non-Steel type switch-ins, and it also lets Bellibolt effectively use Electromorphosis without having to take damage first. It's also a powerful tool against Unaware walls such as Skeledirge.

  • Sucker Punch: While weak, Sucker Punch snipes Pokemon that activate Focus Sash and/or deals chip damage when Bellibolt is guaranteed to go down.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy Bellibolt offensively checks big threats like Roaring Moon and Dragapult by walling their non-Terastal sets and nabbing surprise KOs.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass Bellibolt can stay in versus common Pokemon such as Hippowdon and Breloom, sponge their attacks, and either chunk them or survive and reposition.

  • Electric-type: Maximizing Parabolic Charge damage is a viable option.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 28 Spe: This spread is to avoid the 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Rotom-W and Hydreigon's Hydro Pump and Draco Meteor. 28 Speed EVs allow Bellibolt to outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon. 28 Defense EVs are enough to survive Focus Sash Garchomp's Earthquake, which notably becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground.

  • 228 HP / 156 SpA / 124 SpD: This EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump. This spread can also use a Quiet nature and 0 Speed EVs for the slowest possible Volt Switch.

  • 228 HP / 52 Def / 180 SpA / 44 SpD / 4 Spe: This spread sacrifices outspeeding Hippowdon for surviving a +1 or Choice Band Dragonite Earthquake.

sets.name: Fat Bellibolt
sets.description:
• Bellibolt's stats allow it to be deceptively bulky, and a pure Electric typing is not terrible on a defensive Pokemon with reliable recovery and pivoting.

  • Parabolic Charge: Parabolic Charge gives Bellibolt a more constant stream of recovery, though it is much less punishing than Discharge.

  • Volt Switch: Volt Switch maintains initiative when predicting switches after bringing Bellibolt in on something that it walls, such as defensive Gholdengo or Corviknight.

  • Chilling Water: Chilling Water punishes Garchomp and Hippowdon on the switch.

  • Thunder Wave: This disrupts opponents if Bellibolt doesn't have Discharge.

  • Fairy-type Tera Blast: Tera Blast hits common Dragon-types such as Garchomp and Baxcalibur after Terastallizing into the Fairy typing.

  • Soak: Soak catches Electric-resistant foes on the switch and forces them to either switch out or Terastallize early, with major targets including Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Grass: Terastallizing into the Grass typing flips the matchup against Ground-types like Hippowdon and Garchomp on its head, turning their super effective attacks into resisted hits that still activate Electromorphosis. Tera Grass Bellibolt also absorbs Spore versus Breloom and Amoonguss, effectively walling them as well.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera Bellibolt comfortably walls Dragon-types, removing a lot of their offensive pressure.

  • Water: Water is just generally good to have as a defensive Tera type. It also gives Bellibolt STAB on Chilling Water for slightly more damage.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 244 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive two Glaive Rushes from Adamant Baxcalibur if it is not in a position to Terastallize. The physical bulk lets Bellibolt always survive Life Orb Garchomp's Earthquake, and after Terastallization into a neutral type, it becomes a 3HKO. 28 Speed EVs allow it to outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers provides long-term passive recovery alongside Slack Off, which can make Bellibolt very difficult to remove. Leftovers also removes any chance of a 2HKO from powerful physical threats such as Baxcalibur.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry is a good backup option if Leftovers is already in use.

  • Rocky Helmet: Rocky Helmet Bellibolt can switch into and passively punish physical attackers; the chip damage can also break Focus Sash and weaken foes into range of Electromorphosis-boosted attacks.

sets.name: Bespectacled Bellibolt
sets.description:
• With such good natural bulk, Bellibolt can easily survive hits from common threats and nab surprise KOs in return with a cheeky Choice Specs set.

  • Discharge / Thunderbolt: Discharge or Thunderbolt is the preferred primary STAB move, as either one takes advantage of Choice Specs more than Parabolic Charge. With an Electromorphosis boost, Bellibolt can 2HKO common switch-ins without having to Terastallize, like Dragapult.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast is important for coverage; with a Fairy typing, Bellibolt reliably checks non-Tera Steel Dragon-types. Muddy Water should be used with Tera Electric.

  • Muddy Water versus Parabolic Charge: Muddy Water lets Bellibolt win one-on-one against Hippowdon. Parabolic Charge should be used alongside Muddy Water if running Tera Electric.

Tera Types

  • Fairy-type: Tera Fairy lets Bellibolt turn the tables on bulky Dragon-types such as Baxcalibur and Roaring Moon by scoring a surprise KO on a potential setup attempt.

  • Grass-type: Tera Grass turns Bellibolt's only weakness into a resistance, and Tera Blast gets surprise OHKOs on threats such as physically defensive Hippowdon.

  • Electric-type: Tera Electric + Choice Specs turns Bellibolt into an offensive behemoth, and with an Electromorphosis boost it can OHKO resistant Pokemon like Dragapult, Hydreigon, and specially defensive Garganacl.

EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 28 Def / 196 SpA / 28 SpD / 28 Spe: This EV spread allows Bellibolt to survive Choice Specs-boosted Draco Meteor from Hydreigon and Earthquake from Focus Sash Garchomp; Garchomp's Earthquake becomes a 3HKO if Bellibolt Terastallizes into a typing without a weakness to Ground. The Speed EVs outspeed 4 Speed EV Hippowdon, while the Special Attack EVs are enough to OHKO physically defensive Hippowdon with Muddy Water.

Scovillain.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Sun Attacker
sets.description:
• Tera Fire Scovillain's damage under sun is absurd, managing to barely KO even Fire-resistant targets. Most notably, its ability to defeat most Pokemon, even powerful Dragon-types, without fearing surprise Terastallizations makes Scovillain a charming offensive option.

  • Overheat and Fire Blast: Overheat combined with Tera Fire and Choice Specs guarantees the KO on Garchomp without bulk EVs, and OHKO offensive Roaring Moon after Stealth Rock damage. Against the frailer Dragapult, Tera Fire and Fire Blast is enough to earn the KO. It's recommended to run both Fire STAB moves because Overheat's added damage can be necessary to guarantee certain KOs, but its stat drop can be fatal.

  • Solar Beam versus Leaf Storm: Solar Beam nails the few bulky Water-types that can survive Scovillain's absurd attacks, most notable examples being notably Gastrodon and Assault Vest Azumarill. However, Leaf Storm can be used in its stead for the ability to OHKO Hippowdon, despite it summoning sand.

  • Flamethrower: Flamethrower is perfectly accurateand is typically more than enough to nip off frailer foes.

  • Substitute: In spite of the type matchup, Scovillain is deceptively weak to Kingambit thanks to Sucker Punch. Additionally, many Pokemon will use Protect in front of Scovillain to waste sun turns— most notably Espathra and Dondozo. Against all of these foes, a well-timed Substitute can guarantee the win.

Tera Types

  • Fire: It is almost mandatory to run Tera Fire on this Scovillain set. Tera Fire guarantees KOs on most Dragon-types.

  • Ghost: The abundantly common Dragonite is incredibly strong against Scovillain. Should Stealth Rock support be deemed enough to let Scovillain sweep teams reasonably, even without Tera Fire, using Tera Ghost to gain an immunity to Extreme Speed can be very useful.

  • Rock: Tera Rock with Tera Blast can be a decent alternative to Tera Fire, as it gives Scovillain excellent coverage and also provides a much-needed countermeasure to Dragonite's Extreme Speed.

sets.name: Moody Ace
sets.description:
• The metagame's abundance of Unaware Pokemon makes it difficult to maneuver Moody Pokemon in general. On top of that, Scovillain is held back by the powerful Dragon-types that resist its STAB combination. However, Scovillain still carves a niche for itself by being the only Moody Pokemon with excellent recovery moves, Leech Seed and Ingrain, allowing it to win a variety of matchups.

  • Protect and Substitute: Protect and Substitute are mandatory to get the most opportunities to activate Moody. Once you gain enough Defense or Special Defense boosts that Scovillain's Substitute can tank an attack without breaking, it tends to be easy to win the game. Note, however, that Protect, Substitute, and Leftovers's animation make Scovillain very vulnerable to losing via timer.

  • Flamethrower: With enough Moody boosts, Scovillain's Flamethrower tends to be enough to break through an entire team. There are very few Pokemon that are immune or quadruply resistant to Fire, and Flamethrower has good PP and accuracy, which makes it an easy pick.

  • Giga Drain: Unlike Flamethrower, Giga Drain gets shrugged off by a lot of Pokemon, even at +6, notably Corviknight and Dragonite. However, an attacking move that helps recover HP lost from Substitutes gives Scovillain more mileage off of Moody. Giga Drain is also notable to more reliably defeat Dondozo, one of the Unaware Pokemon that would give Scovillain a lot of trouble otherwise.

  • Leech Seed: Leech Seed combined with Protect, Substitute, and Leftovers helps Scovillain restore HP while collecting Moody boosts, as well as chipping Pokemon it'd otherwise have trouble against, such as Clodsire.

  • Ingrain: Ingrain is an alternative recovery option that makes Scovillain impervious to phazing moves. When purely considering recovery, it's more reliable than the inaccurate 90% accurate Leech Seed.

  • Fairy Tera Blast: Tera Blast with Tera Fairy is an excellent option that helps remedy Scovillain's Dragon susceptibility, particularly making the Infiltrator Dragapult and Roaring Moon matchup easier.

Tera Types

  • Water: The Water resistance helps Scovillain beat Dondozo. Even though Dondozo ignores Scovillain's Defense boosts via Unaware, with Tera Water, Scovillain's Substitute can tank a Wave Crash. Tera Water also keeps the Scovillain's Steel resistance, unlike Tera Grass, which makes it easier to check Scizor—a common priority user that people attempt to use to check Moody Pokemon.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy mitigating Scovillain's weakness to Dragon-types is massively helpful.

EV Spreads

  • 180 HP / 220 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 100 Spe with Bold: This spread bolsters Scovillain’s physical bulk. Notably, Tera Water Scovillain's Substitute manages to survive Dondozo's Wave Crash with this spread. The Speed allows Scovillain to outspeed slow Baxcalibur and Gholdengo, as well as Dragapult with one Moody Speed boost. The HP is adjusted to make maximum use of Leftovers, with the resulting stat having a remainder of 1 when divided by 16. The remaining EVs are split between Special Attack and Special Defense because, at level 50, investing 8 EVs in either stat has no benefit over investing 4.

Espathra.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Speed Passer
sets.description:
• Espathra is the only option for the coveted Speed Boost + Baton Pass combination, which can be extremely deadly for setting up sweeps!

  • Lumina Crash: Lumina Crash ensures that Espathra isn't totally shut down by Taunt, and the guaranteed -2 Special Defense drop helps against Unaware walls.

  • Reflect: Reflect can stop priority attacks from easily revenge killing your chosen Baton Pass partner.

  • Some Teammates: While most Pokemon love getting Baton Pass boosts, especially consider Pokemon that resist Espathra's common weaknesses, such as Hydreigon, Roaring Moon, Sylveon, and Kingambit. Corviknight is also worth considering due to Power Trip.

Other Options

  • Hypnosis: While extremely risky, putting a foe to sleep lets Espathra easily stack up on boosts.

Tera Types

  • Espathra should usually avoid Terastallizing if possible, since its point is to help other Pokemon sweep. Consider these two options as fairly situational.

  • Normal: With a Normal Tera type, Espartha can set up against its Ghost types and isn't worried about Shadow Sneak anymore.

  • Ghost: Ghost Tera type makes Espartha immune to Extreme Speed, making passing against Dragonite much easier.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash is the best way to guarantee passing at least one Speed boost, though it's a lackluster option for passing multiple boosts compared to other items.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is the easy option to recommend since it pairs well with Protect and Substitute.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry should be used if Espathra is planning on passing Speed to teammates that want Leftovers, such as Skeledirge and Garganacl.

sets.name: Calm Mind
sets.description:
• With Calm Mind and Speed Boost rapidly increasing Stored Power's damage output, Espathra is a dangerous wincon against bulkier teams, as it even overwhelms Unaware foes.

  • Dazzling Gleam: This provides coverage against Dark-types such as Roaring Moon and Hydreigon.

  • Protect versus Substitute: Protect is the most reliable way to get a free turn of Speed Boost. Substitute is a riskier option for Speed Boost stalling, but it severely punishes passive Pokemon and works extremely well on dual screen teams.

  • EV Spread: The given EV spread allows Espathra to outspeed Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle after one turn of Speed Boost.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: When paired with Tera Blast, Tera Fighting is Espathra's best hope of defeating Kingambit.

  • Fire: Tera Fire and Tera Blast roast Scizor, and deal massive damage to Gholdengo and Kingambit.

  • Fairy: Fairy Tera type makes setting up on Hydreigon a much more realistic scenario and severely punishes Choice-locked Dragon-types like Dragapult.

  • Dark: Tera Dark provides gives Espathra a valuable Shadow Sneak resistance and does a better shot of defeating weakened Gholdengo.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description: This set will be up for reservation once the analysis process for Series 2 begins.

Tinkaton.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Offensive Support
sets.description:
• Tinkaton boasts an impressive support movepool alongside a fantastic typing in Fairy / Steel.

  • Encore: Encore can open up opportunities for Tinkaton or its teammates, locking foes into status moves or attacks that are resisted.

  • Knock Off versus Play Rough: Knock Off is Tinkaton's best attack against Gholdengo and is a strong utility move in general. Meanwhile, Play Rough provides offensive STAB and is Tinkaton's best option against Dragon-types.

  • Thunder Wave: With Mold Breaker, Tinkaton is capable of paralyzing Gholdengo and Garganacl with Thunder Wave.

  • Swords Dance: Despite Tinkaton's low offensive stats, it can still perform as an offensive Pokemon thanks to Gigaton Hammer's enormous 160 Base Power and Swords Dance. Combined with Mold Breaker, Tinkaton can even hit Unaware Dondozo with boosted Play Rough.

Other Options

  • Bulldoze: Bulldoze can be run instead of Thunder Wave, acting as an offensive alternative to reducing Speed that also breaks Focus Sashes.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low / Medium: Tinkaton already has great typing and makes good use of items to improve its survivability. Its reliance on Tera largely depends on the matchups it wants to patch up.

  • Water: Tera Water turns Tinkaton's Fire-type weakness into a resistance, allowing it to potentially lock Chi-Yu and Volcarona into resisted moves.

  • Flying: Tera Flying makes Tinkaton immune to Ground, which can be useful in avoiding Earthquake from the likes of Ting-Lu, Garchomp, and Great Tusk.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Tinkaton a stronger Play Rough. With Mold Breaker ignoring Multiscale, fully invested Adamant Tera Fairy Play Rough almost always OHKOs offensive Dragonite.

  • Ground: Tera Ground thwarts Volt Switch pivoting, potentially giving Tinkaton extra turns to set up for itself or teammates. Bulldoze also becomes a more serviceable attack.

  • Steel: Tera Steel powers up the already amazing Gigaton Hammer, but at the cost of being weaker to Fighting- and Dark-type attacks.

Items

  • Air Balloon: Air Balloon let's Tinkaton set up Stealth Rock against other common entry hazard setters such as Garchomp and Glimmora without the use of Flying Tera and pairs incredibly well with Encore.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash allows Tinkaton to get support moves like Thunder Wave off even against powerful attacks from the likes of Terastallized Chi-Yu, Garchomp, and Dragapult.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers has great synergy with Swords Dance and Encore, allowing it to set up while healing off some of the damage from weak moves.

EV Speads

  • 252 Atk / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly or Adamant: This is a simple offensive spread that takes full advantage of Air Balloon or Focus Sash for survivability. If running Jolly, you can repurpose 24 Speed EVs to defensive stats and still outrun Jolly Annihilape.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 148 Def / 20 SpD / 92 Spe with Careful: The HP and Defense investment let's Tinkaton survive Adamant Dragonite's Earthquake into Extreme Speed. The Special Defense investment allows Tinkaton to survive one Timid Choice Specs Fire Blast from Hydreigon, two Modest Choice Specs Shadow Balls from Dragapult, and three uninvested Shadow Balls from Gholdengo. The Speed investment allows Tinkaton to outspeed a paralyzed Choice Scarf Timid Chi-Yu.

Palafin.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: This looks like a job for Palafin
sets.description:
• Palafin's stats are middling, but after switching out once it will forme change into Palafin-H, which boasts the highest base Attack in the format, making it an effective wall breaker with Wave Crash, and a great revenge killer with Jet Punch.

  • Flip Turn: Flip Turn is perfect for letting Palafin do some chip damage and escaping before it transforms into the heroic Palafin-H! It's possible to drop if coverage is desperately needed, but forcing Palafin to switch and losing out on a useful pivot move is not the right call in most cases.

  • Ice Punch: Ice Punch is Palafin-H's best bet against Dragonite before it Terastallizes, and deals decent damage to Amoonguss.

  • Close Combat versus Drain Punch: Close Combat is good coverage, hitting Rotom-W for neutral damage and covering Baxcalibur, Iron Bundle, and Roaring Moon. While weaker, Drain Punch's lack of defensive stat drops makes sense for a better matchup against Focus Sash Chien-Pao and restoring a good amount of health against Iron Bundle before usually KOing it with Jet Punch.

  • Adamant versus Jolly: An Adamant nature increases the damage Wave Crash and Jet Punch inflict, making Palafin-H a more effective wall breaker and revenge killer. A Jolly nature enables Palafin-H to outspeed Jolly Mimikyu, Jolly Baxcalibur, and Jolly Annihilape.

Other Options

  • Grass Knot: Grass Knot lets Palafin-H potentially 2HKO physically defensive Dondozo, whose normally a good Palafin-H check. It doesn't cover anything else that's useful, with Azumarill and Rotom-W being fairly lightweight.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Terastallization can make Palafin-H to an even more potent revenge killer and cleaner, but its not reliant on it.

  • Water: Tera Water makes Palafin-H a potent late-game cleaner, making it the Tera Type that makes sense for most teams.

  • Electric: If willing to give up on consistent coverage by using Tera Blast, Tera Electric Palafin-H deals a big amount of damage against common bulky Water-types like Azumarill, Dondozo, and Toxapex, in addition to saving Palafin-H from Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type turns all of Palafin-H's weaknesses into resistances, giving it a favorable matchup against Rotom-W, and making it immune to Spore from Breloom, Amoonguss, and Brute Bonnet, and having a good Tera Blast against Azumarill and Dondozo. If using the niche Grass Knot, it consistently 2HKOs all but specially defensive Dondozo.

Items

  • Choice Band: Choice Band gives Palafin-H the most amount of wallbreaking and revenge killing power.

  • Assault Vest: Palafin-H's bulk is good enough to survive some powerful attacks with Assault Vest, such as Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry, and it works well with bulkier EV spreads.

  • Mystic Water: If Choice Band is used by another teammate, Mystic Water is a great alternative thanks to most of Palafin-H's attacks being Water-type anyways.

  • Life Orb: Life Orb works well with revenge killing and makes the niche Grass Knot always 2HKO specially defensive Dondozo, but the severe compromise to Palafin-H's bulk, especially with Wave Crash recoil, makes it a lesser option.

Bulkier EV Spreads

  • 140 HP / 252 Atk / 116 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread outspeeds Jolly Breloom, and lets Palafin-H survive Tera Flying Choice Band Tera Blast from Dragonite from full health.

  • 252 HP / 236 Atk / 20 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom, and survives Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage. If surviving that isn't important or if using Assault Vest, feel free to swap the HP and Attack investments.

  • 60 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 12 SpD / 180 Spe with Jolly: This speedy Assault Vest spread outspeeds Jolly Annihilape, survives Jolly Life Orb Tera Dark Chien-Pao's Crunch from full health, and survives Modest Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast after Stealth Rock damage.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Palafin-H's powerful priority and good Speed tier separate it from other Bulk Up sweepers, such as Annihilape.

  • Drain Punch: Even without Tera Fighting, Drain Punch's extra healing makes it a great choice for coverage, and it does massive damage to Kingambit, Chien-Pao, and Meowscarada.

  • Taunt versus Substitute: With Taunt, Palafin-H excels at breaking through troublesome defensive Pokemon, such as Corviknight, Wo-Chien, and Skeledirge, and it also gives Palafin a decent move against Ting-Lu and Hippowdon before switching out for Zero to Hero. Substitute has a worse matchup defensive set-up Pokemon, but in exchange it turns Garganacl into an excellent set up opportunity and makes Palafin-H a fearsome sweeper with Toxic Spikes support.

Other Options

  • Ice Punch: If using Tera Water, Ice Punch is a reasonable option for hitting Dragon-types, though it does leave Palafin-H walled by Rotom-W.

  • Encore: While harder to justify than the other support options, Encore does give Palafin-H new chances to set up, punishing slower set-up sweepers like Annihilape in particular.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Unless using Tera Blast, Palafin-H is only pressured to Terastallize to improve certain matchups.

  • Fairy: Besides being an excellent defensive typing that punishes Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu for using Dark-type attacks, Tera Fairy gives Palafin-H a great offensive option against Dragon-types like Dragonite and Baxcalibur, as well as coverage against Wo-Chien and Meowscarada with Tera Blast.

  • Fighting: Boosting Drain Punch's power with Tera Fighting can make Palafin-H even more difficult to take down and can seriously compromise defensive Rotom-W thanks to Taunt or Substitute blocking Will-O-Wisp. However, it does make Palafin-H particularly vulnerable to Flutter Mane.

  • Water: Tera Water helps Palafin-H pick off more threats with Jet Punch, having a good shot to OHKO offensive Flutter Mane unboosted after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Poison: Besides offering a useful Fairy resistance, Tera Poison lets Palafin-H absorb Toxic Spikes and stop Toxic without a support move, making it a viable alternative.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers takes advantage of Palafin-H's slow setup and is a requirement if using Substitute.

  • Punching Glove: If using Taunt, Punching Glove is a good option to free up Leftovers for a teammate. Palafin-H appreciates the extra power Jet Punch and Drain Punch gain, and it becomes harder for Rocky Helmet Dragonite to wear it down.

  • Covert Cloak: If using Taunt, Covert Cloak turns the tables on the Garganacl matchup in addition to protecting Palafin-H from surprise Light Ball Flings from foes like Annihilape.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 140 SpD / 116 Spe with Careful: This spread maximizes Palafin-H's Special Defense while still outspeeding Jolly Breloom.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximizing Speed allows Palafin-H to outspeed fast support Pokemon like Mimikyu and Annihilape so it can Taunt them. This spread also outspeeds the rare Choice Specs Hydreigon, which can deal massive damage with Draco Meteor if not using Tera Fairy.

  • 252 HP / 140 Atk / 116 Spe with Adamant: This is a far more offensive approach to the set, letting Palafin-H function more as a revenge killer with the potential to sweep rather than a bulky setup Pokemon. This is best used with Tera Water, as Palafin-H will then OHKO offensive Flutter Mane with unboosted Jet Punch. The given Speed is for outspeeding Jolly Breloom.

Orthworm.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: IronPress
sets.description:
• Thanks to Earth Eater, Orthworm can wall sets of many physical Dragon-types like Garchomp and Baxcalibur.

  • Heavy Slam versus Iron Head: Heavy Slam can 2HKO offensive Dragapult, OHKOs Flutter Mane, and deals much more damage to Iron Valiant, while Iron Head is superior for Dragonite.

  • Rest and Chesto Berry: Rest is an option with Chesto Berry to heal Orthworm in a pinch, giving it better longevity.

  • Shed Tail: Shed Tail gives Orthworm use when IronPress isn't as effective. The surprise factor comes at the price of the reduced effectiveness of IronPress.

  • Substitute: Substitute stops Salt Cure damage from Garganacl and phazing from Garchomp's Dragon Tail.

Other Options

  • Earthquake is an option to hit Gholdengo, but it won't 2HKO, so Recover is still a problem.

Items

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry allows two uses of Shed Tail.

  • Leftovers: Leftovers is a consistent option, especially in conjunction with Substitute.

Tera Types

  • Poison: Tera Poison provides a key Fighting resistance and single weakness and maintains a key resistance to Flower Trick, letting Orthworm preform better against Meowscarada, Great Tusk, and Iron Valiant.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy provides a Fighting resistance and Dragon immunity, turning Dragon Tail Garchomp into setup bait, and dealing with Great Tusk, Iron Valiant, and Roaring Moon.

EV spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: This EV spread makes Orthworm much less likely to be 2HKOd by Life Orb Dragapult.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 Spe with Impish: This spread can be used to outspeed Adamant Kingambit, most Corviknight, and Skeledirge. This can be very useful if using Shed Tail.

sets.name: Shed Tail Support
sets.description:
• Orthworm's good physical bulk and ability make it a great user of Shed Tail, and a reliable Stealth Rock user.

  • Body Press: Body Press has a good chance to OHKO offensive Meowscarada, and threatens Kingambit and Roaring Moon.

  • Heavy Slam versus Iron Head: A Steel-type STAB move helps hit some Ghost-types like Mimikyu and Flutter Mane, who are OHKOed by Heavy Slam, and deals massive damage to Iron Valiant. Iron Head is an alternative for heavy foes like Dragonite.

  • Spikes: Orthworm can also set Spikes, but this compromises its ability to pass Shed Tail.

  • A Special Teammate: Many Pokemon can benefit from Orthworm's Shed Tail. One example is Air Balloon Gholdengo, which puts a lot of pressure on defensive foes when behind a Substitute.

Tera Types

  • This Orthworm isn't usually meant to Terastalize, since that's better served by the teammates its passing a Substitute to.

  • Poison: Tera Poison leaves Orthworm with only one fairly rare weakness, and aiding it against former threats like Great Tusk and Iron Valiant.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy gives Orthworm a Fighting resistance, as well as a way to absorb Garchomp's Dragon Tail while still staying in.

EV spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 SpD: This spread maximizes Orthworm's physical bulk. Running a Speed IV of 0 may be tempting, but being outsped by bulky Brute Bonnet is risky.

  • 252 HP / 116 Def / 140 Spe with Impish: This spread outspeeds Kingambit, and most Skeledirge and Corviknight. Outspeeding Kingambit and Corviknight prevents Taunt from stopping Shed Tail, and let's Orthworm bring in a teammate against Torch Song.

  • 252 HP / 44 Def / 212 Spe with Jolly: This spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and Jolly Brute Bonnet. Mach Punch still does a lot, but thanks to Sitrus Berry, Orthworm will have enough HP left to Shed Tail to a check or counter.

Glimmora.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Debris Lead
sets.description:
• With a solid early-game Speed tier, utility, high Special Attack, and decent coverage options, Glimmora can set the tone of a battle, sometimes scoring KOs before fulfilling its main role of setting entry hazards.

  • Mud Shot: This will fail to KO many foes—most notably other Glimmora—but it is a valuable form of speed control that can immediately turn the game in your favor.

  • Mortal Spin: If using Stealth Rock weak teammates like Dragonite, Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, or Baxcalibur, clearing the hazards with Mortal Spin can be quite useful, in addition to putting a timer on common entry hazard setters such as Ting-Lu and Annihilape.

  • Memento: Memento immediately makes way for a devastating sweeper to set up against foes with halved offensive stats and potentially lowered Speed.

  • Toxic Spikes Partners: While Toxic Debris doesn't gurantee Toxic Spikes will be set up, it's still good to consider running a teammate with it in mind. Wo-Chien, Defensive Dragonite sets, Annihilape, and Bulk Up Palafin-H are good examples to consider.

Tera Types

  • Flying: Tera Flying vastly improves Glimmora's matchup against Ting-Lu, Great Tusk, and Garchomp.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type is an option to absorb Spore from Breloom, Amoonguss, and Brute Bonnet.

Items

  • Focus Sash: This is the most reliable item for setting up Stealth Rock.

  • Air Balloon: With Air Balloon, Glimmora vastly improves its match-up against Ground-type leads such as Garchomp.

sets.name: Bulky Support
sets.description:
• 244 HP / 132 Def / 132 SpD: This EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 244 HP / 76 Def / 188 SpD: The given EVs allow Glimmora to almost always avoid a 2HKO from Timid Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, survive Glaive Rush + Ice Shard from Baxcalibur, and have a good chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

sets.name: All-Out Attacker
sets.description: • This set does not have a full write-up yet. If you'd like to finish this, feel free to reserve it here!

Flamigo.overview:
Welcome to the next generation of Battle Stadium Singles! In this new and exciting metagame, new ideas are constantly developing, so this analysis will constantly be updated to reflect metagame trends.

If you feel this analysis is not up to date, feel free to check out the thread for this Pokemon and post suggestions. For more resources on Series 1 in general, check out this thread.

sets.name: Scrappy Choice Item
sets.description:
• Scrappy gives Flamigo a unique niche, letting it throw out powerful Close Combats that are unsafe for Gholdengo and Dragapult to take!

  • Throat Chop is a decent filler move, letting Flamigo shut down Sylveon's Hyper Voice and Skeledirge's Torch Song. Note that Close Combat still does more damage to most Ghost-types.

  • Tailwind is a filler move that gives Flamigo's team some extreme speed control before it goes down.

Tera Types

  • Fighting: Tera Fighting lets Flamigo fully take advantage of Scrappy, giving Choice Scarf sets a 81.3% chance to OHKO offensive Dragapult.

  • Fire: Tera Fire makes Flamigo immune to Will-O-Wisp, letting Choice Band sets more easily break through Skeledirge, and gives Flamigo the option to 2HKO Corviknight with Tera Blast.

Items

  • Choice Scarf: With Choice Scarf, Flamigo outspeeds major threats such as Dragapult and Hydreigon, making it a more effective late-game cleaner.

  • Choice Band: Choice Band lets Flamigo deal massive damage, giving it a shot at 2HKOing Skeledirge with Close Combat.

Dondozo.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: OHKO Fisher
sets.description:
• With immense bulk, Yawn, and Unaware, Dondozo is not only an impressive defensive Pokemon, but one of the most dangerous OHKO fishers in the game.

  • Wave Crash: Despite the recoil, Wave Crash is the preferred option over Liquidation in most cases, purely for the damage output.

  • Protect: Protect is not only useful for scouting for unexpected Tera types, but pairs well with Yawn and Leftovers to give Dondozo more longevity.

  • Rest and Sleep Talk: If Leftovers isn't possible to use, these two move are an alternative way to keep Dondozo healthy.

  • Avalanche: Avalanche can be used to deal more consistent damage against Dragon-types.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake deals massive damage to Magnezone, and punishes some Tera Electric Pokemon that may attempt to mess with Dondozo, such as Baxcalibur and Chien-Pao.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Dondozo's defensive typing is fantastic, so Terastallization is only needed in rather rare situations.

  • Grass: A Grass Tera type is useful enough for covering Dondozo's weaknesses, and the Spore immunity makes it capable of beating Breloom and Brute Bonnet too.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type lets Dondozo take on powerful Dragon-type attacks much more easily, and is just a good defensive typing in general.

  • Flying: Flying may seem like an odd Tera type, but it can lead to your Dondozo winning mirror matches thanks to the Fissure immunity.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP versus 252 HP: If using Leftovers, running 244 HP will give Dondozo one extra HP of recovery, which is easy to take advantage of with Protect. However, if not using Leftovers, 252 HP is better for taking less damage from Stealth Rock.

  • 244 HP / 148 Def / 116 SpD with Impish: This EV spread makes Dondozo extremely likely to avoid a 2HKO from Adamant Baxcalibur's Electric Tera Blast with Leftovers recovery, while still giving Dondozo decent Special Defense.

  • 244 HP / 4 Atk / 252 Def / 4 SpD / 4 Spe with Impish: This more extreme spread helps against powerful Tera users, with the ability to avoid a 2HKO from Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Electric Tera Blast or Choice Band Tera Dragon Dragapult's Dragon Darts with Leftovers. This comes at the cost of being much more vulnerable to weaker special attackers.

  • 252 Def / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: With Dondozo's massive HP stat, it's still able to take physical hits fairly well with this spread, while now avoiding a 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast if it lacks an offensive boosting item.

sets.name: BIG FLOPPA (Assault Vest)
sets.description:
• Dondozo's good power and bulk lend it nicely to an Assault Vest set, and is particularly good at punishing otherwise troublesome special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu

  • Avalanche: Avalanche punishes Flying- and Dragon-types with super effective coverage.

  • Body Press: This is valuable Fighting-type coverage for most foes that would otherwise be a good switch in to Dondozo, such as Meowscarada, Wo-Chien, Magnezone, Kingambit, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fissure: Fissure allows Dondozo to potentially cheese its way through something that might otherwise wall it.

  • Heavy Slam: Dondozo is heavy enough to deal serious damage to Fairy-types such as Mimikyu and Flutter Mane. Just note that Chien-Pao is shockingly heavy, so Body Press or Wave Crash is preferred against that threat.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake offers more reliable Ground-type coverage at the cost of not being an instant KO like Fissure.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization will help against some specific checks to Dondozo, it's typing is great for general purposes.

  • Grass: Tera Grass removes Dondozo’s usual set of weaknesses and allows it to absorb spore from the likes of Amoonguss, Breloom, and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy grants Dondozo a new set of resistances to take advantage of with its phenomenal bulk and also grants it a powerful STAB to hit Dragon- and Fighting-types with if it runs Tera Blast.

  • Steel: When paired with Heavy Slam, Dondozo can now 2HKO Iron Bundle without Stealth Rock support, in addition to gaining a fantastic defensive typing.

  • Ground: Terastallizing into a Ground-type allows Dondozo to block the Electric-type attacks commonly aimed at it while also giving it STAB on Earthquake.

  • Dragon: Tera Dragon gives Dondozo a resistance to both Electric- and Water-type attacks, allowing it to stand up to Rotom-W much better.

EV Spreads

  • 44 HP / 212 Atk / 252 SpD with Careful: This EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Chi-Yu's Dark Pulse.

  • 252 Atk / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Adamant: This more offensive spread makes sense if you have better options for Chi-Yu.

sets.name: Curse
sets.description:
• With Unaware, Dondozo becomes an effective and difficult to break Curse user.

  • Fissure: Even with Curse being the point of this set, Dondozo can still effectively fish for OHKOs with Fissure when it's not in a favorable set-up position.

  • Avalanche: Many foes will Terrastallize into a Flying-type to avoid an expected Fissure, which makes Avalanche a particularly useful coverage move.

  • Earthquake: Earthquake helps against Magnezone and common users of Tera Electric such as Baxcalibur.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: Water is an excellent defensive typing, so Dondozo won't need to Terastallize often.

  • Grass: With a Grass Tera Type, Dondozo can effectively set up on Breloom and Brute Bonnet.

  • Fairy: The Dragon immunity that Tera Fairy provides makes setting up on powerful foes like Choice Band Dragapult and Roaring Moon much easier.

  • Flying: If using Fissure, Tera Flying is a good choice for potentially beating other Dondozo.

Annihilape.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Thanks to great bulk and the dangerous Rage Fist, Annihilape is one of the premier bulky set-up sweepers of Battle Stadium Singles.

  • Taunt: Taunt helps you deal with annoying Pokemon like Whirlwind Ting-Lu, Dondozo, Will-O-Wisp Skeledirge, and Hippowdon, to mention a few, forcing them to attack and boost Rage Fist. This can work on Toxapex, but be warned that Toxapex commonly carries Mental Herb, which could get Annihilape poisoned if it doesn't Terastallize.

  • Encore: Encore is an interesting alternative to Taunt, not able to directly shut down defensive answers to Annihilape, but it severely punishes them when Annihilape switches into a support move.

  • Vital Spirit: With Vital Spirit, Annihilape can absorb Spore from foes like Breloom, Brute Bonnet, and Amoonguss.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization is quite helpful at saving Annihilape from certain extremely powerful wallbreakers such as Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Flutter Mane, but Annihilape is perfectly functional without it.

  • Fire: In addition to giving a useful resistance to Fairy, Fire, and Ice attacks from dangerous foes like Flutter Mane, Chi-Yu, and Chien-Pao, Tera Fire also prevents Will-O-Wisp from hitting.

  • Steel: Steel turns Annihilape's Psychic and Fairy weakness into resistances, as well as being an excellent defensive type overall. It lets Annihilape set up freely on Amoonguss and Toxapex, gives it a better chance of defeating Flutter Mane, and resisting Flower Trick means Meowscarada has a much harder time revenge killing it.

  • Poison: While not as sturdy of a defensive typing as Tera Steel, Tera Poison offers a better matchup against Flutter Mane, does well against Meowscarada, and lets Annihilape freely switch into Toxic and Toxic Spikes later in the match. This also drastically reduces the risk of Taunting Toxapex, which makes this Tera type a menace against stall teams!

  • Flying: Flying helps a lot to avoid Fissure from Dondozo and Ting-Lu, forcing it to attack with moves that boost Rage Fist. It also improves Annihilape's match-up against Great Tusk, and makes Hippowdon an easy foe to set up on.

  • Water: Tera Water is a good choice against Chien-Pao, Chi-Yu, and Palafin-H.

Items

  • Leftovers: Leftovers's residual recovery eases the long-game of setting up.

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: Reducing the HP EVs to 244 gives Annihilape an even HP stat, which lets Annihilape recover its health with Sitrus Berry the moment it gets hit by Ruination. This makes dealing with Ting-Lu and Wo-Chien an easier task.

  • Covert Cloak: Covert Cloak makes Annihilape immune to being Salt Cured, making it a great check against Garganacl. It also gives peace of mind, avoiding potential flinches from Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, or Special Defense drops from Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball.

  • Punching Glove: Removing contact damage from Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin is helpful against defensive Pokemon such as Garchomp and Dragonite.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with Jolly: Maximum Speed mainly helps Annihilape outspeed Gholdengo, Great Tusk, Baxcalibur, and Modest Chi-Yu. With Bulk Up and Rage Fist improving its offense, Annihilape can invest in HP over Attack.

  • 252 HP / 244 SpD / 12 Spe with Careful: More special bulk can make it much more difficult for special attackers such as Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu to revenge kill Annihilape. This spread in particular has a 62.5% chance of surviving Timid Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast.

  • 244 HP / 164 Def / 100 SpD with Careful: This EV spread avoids a OHKO from +2 Chien-Pao, which can be especially helpful with Covert Cloak blocking the flinch chance.

  • 252 HP / 156 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and Cloyster while still giving Annihilape good special bulk.

  • 252 HP / 196 Def / 60 Spe with Impish: This physically defensive spread will survive Tera Flying Adamant Dragonite's Tera Blast, while outspeeding 4 Speed EV Mimikyu and Jolly Brute Bonnet.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Setter
sets.description:
• Annihilape's good bulk and significant offensive presence makes it an easy to use Stealth Rock setter.

  • Rage Fist: Rage Fist is Annihilape’s strongest move; its power and coverage often lets Annihilape either defeat or significantly chip one of the opponent’s Pokemon on top of getting Stealth Rock up.

  • Drain Punch versus Close Combat: The huge amount of Dark-types in this metagame necessitates a Fighting STAB attack. Drain Punch is preferred in most cases for the extra recovery, but Close Combat makes plenty of sense if using Focus Sash and an offensive EV spread.

  • Taunt: Taunt gives Annihilape a strong matchup into bulky walls such as Ting-Lu and opposing setup foes like Volcarona, while also making it easier to boost Rage Fist’s power.

  • Final Gambit: Annihilape's impressive HP stat makes Final Gambit into a powerful KO trading tool, being able to take out bulky foes like Garganacl, Corviknight, Wo-Chien, and Toxapex.

  • Rock Tomb versus Bulldoze: Rock Tomb is an excellent Speed reducing move for its ability to hit Dragonite, and threaten Volcarona and Iron Bundle. Its low accuracy should be noted as a risk, however. Bulldoze trades hitting Dragonite in exchange for dealing good damage against Gholdengo and Iron Moth.

Other Options

  • Encore: Encore is an incredibly powerful move that can lock the opponent into an attacking move to boost Rage Fist's power. Alternatively, it can lock the opponent into a status move.

  • Fling and Light Ball: This gives Annihilape a chance to paralyze a foe, including Gholdengo that lack Covert Cloak, and break potential Focus Sashes too.

  • Curse: This is an excellent way for Annihilape to retire itself from the battle while putting significant pressure on the opponent to switch out and shutting down gimmicks such as Baton Pass.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: This Annihilape is often used quite early in the game to set up Stealth Rock, so Terastallization is often not needed unless it must check a specific threat.

  • Steel: Tera Steel has excellent defensive synergy with Annihilape thanks to the Fairy resistance and doing particularly well on spreads that are faster than -1 Chien-Pao to move before Sacred Sword lands.

  • Fire: Beyond offering a valuable Fairy resistance, the Ice and Fire resistances make Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu easier to deal with.

  • Normal: Ghost-type attacks are incredibly common. Pokemon such as Gholdengo, Dragapult, and opposing Annihilape all struggle against an unexpected Tera Normal.

  • Poison: Tera Poison has a good matchup against Flutter Mane, and lets Annihilape deal with Toxic and Toxic Spikes without needing to Taunt.

Items

  • Focus Sash: Even when using bulky EV spreads, Focus Sash is useful for surviving an attack from foes that can be difficult to EV for, such as Flutter Mane.

  • Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry can be used with specialized spreads to avoid certain 2HKOs. Just make sure to have an even HP stat, to ensure that Sitrus Berry activates after getting hit by Ruination.

  • Roseli Berry: Roseli Berry works well on specially defensive EV spreads designed defeat Flutter Mane leads that lack Focus Sash.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: Vital Spirit adds to Annihilape’s reliability as a lead. Immunity to sleep moves from common Pokemon such as Breloom, Brute Bonnet, Dondozo, Hippowdon, and Skeledirge lets Annihilape thrive with more defensive EV spreads.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate Pokemon are far from common from the format, Defiant can take advantage opposing Speed control moves.

  • Inner Focus: This niche ability prevents flinches from Chien-Pao and Dragonite from happening.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 172 HP / 4 Atk / 212 Def / 4 SpD / 116 Spe with Jolly: This Speed drop based spread allows Annihilape to outspeed -1 Iron Bundle and avoids getting 2HKOed by Focus Sash Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: If using Focus Sash and Close Combat together, maximizing Attack and Speed will win the most matchups.

  • 220 HP / 244 SpD / 44 Spe with Careful: This Roseli Berry based spread lets Annihilape survive Modest Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball and outspeed -1 Garchomp and 4 Speed EV Tinkaton.

Sitrus Berry EV Spreads

  • 228 HP / 180 SpD / 100 Spe with Careful: This Sitrus Berry optimized EV spread avoids a 2HKO from Choice Specs Iron Bundle's Hydro Pump, while outspeeding Adamant Breloom.

  • 244 HP / 244 Def / 20 Spe with Impish: This defensive spread is Annihilape's best chance at being a soft check to Chien-Pao, though note that Swords Dance and Terastallization together can still overwhelm Annihilape.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Thanks to Final Gambit and a decent Speed stat, Choice Scarf Annihilape can cause shocking upsets by revenge killing even bulky sweepers, such as Dragonite!

  • Shadow Claw versus Rage Fist: Shadow Claw is weak, but it's a reliable Ghost-type STAB move that can reliably OHKO Flutter Mane even when using minimum Attack investment. If you can manage to get Annihilape into a weak attack, though, Rage Fist has much more reward associated with it.

  • Final Gambit: If using maximum HP, Final Gambit can potentially OHKO major defensive threats if Annihilape is healthy, such as Garganacl and Corviknight.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Very Situational: Since Annihilape often sacrifices itself with Final Gambit, Terastallization is usually a bad idea unless absolutely needed for a highly specific, match dependent win condition.

  • Ghost: A Ghost Tera type makes Shadow Claw OHKO Dragapult, as well as giving it a 56.3% chance of OHKOing 4 HP Gholdengo.

  • Normal: Tera Normal gives Annihilape an immunity to Ghost-type attacks, potentially getting it a revenge kill against a bulky Flutter Mane it wouldn't otherwise.

Abilities

  • Vital Spirit: The immunity to Spore gives Annihilape a good opportunity to switch into Breloom, and it need not worry about Yawn.

  • Defiant: While Intimidate is not particularly common, punishing that and Speed drops can lead to devastating surprise sweeps.

Clodsire.overview:
With Paradox Pokemon being introduced, Series 2 is bringing big new changes to Battle Stadium Singles! This is a modified Series 1 analysis that takes Paradox Pokemon into account. We will update this overview and analysis again once the metagame settles more. For more information on Series 2, check out the resource thread.

If you feel that this analysis is missing important information, feel free to leave feedback here.

sets.name: Support
sets.description:
• While Clodsire is lacking in physical bulk compared to Dondozo and Skeledirge, it makes up for it in having a fantastic support movepool.

  • Yawn: Yawn is very effective at forcing switches, which is especially dangerous if Stealth Rock is set up.

  • Protect: In addition to benefiting from Leftovers, Protect pairs well with Yawn.

  • Low Kick: This prevents Clodsire from being totally walled by Tera Steel Hydreigon.

  • Amnesia: With Amnesia, Clodsire has a far better match-up against powerful special attacking foes such as Hydreigon and Iron Bundle.

  • Black Sludge versus Leftovers: Black Sludge may seem appealing, but it punishes Clodsire for Terastalliizing unless it becomes Tera Poison, so Leftovers is preferred unless Leftovers is already on something else.

Tera Types

  • Flying: With a Flying Tera type, Clodsire no longer has to worry about Earthquake or Fissure.

  • Steel: A Steel Tera type allows Clodsire to take on powerful Dragon-type attacks, without the worry of Gholdengo dealing massive damage.

  • Poison: With Tera Poison, Clodsire not only becomes a better check to Grass- and Water-types such as Meowscarda and Rotom-W, but it can also safely run Black Sludge to punish users of Trick.

  • Fairy: A Fairy Tera type will stop powerful Dragon-type attacks cold without making Clodsire weak to Earthquake, but it comes at the cost of compromising its ability to check Gholdengo.

  • Dark: Espathra's Stored Power is a big issue for Clodsire, so Tera Dark can flip the tables on it.

Abilities

  • Unaware: If you're planning to use Clodsire to its fullest defensive potential, Unaware is the best bet against setup foes.

  • Water Absorb: Water Absorb sacrifices overall defensive potential in exchange for being able to wall Rotom-W without needing to Terastallize. If setting up Stealth Rock is important, this can be worth it.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 252 SpD / 4 Spe with Careful: Maximizing Special Defense is Clodsire's best hope for handling powerful special attackers such as Choice Specs Hydreigon.

  • 252 HP / 252 Def / 4 Spe with Impish: Clodsire's Defense may be mediocre, but with maximum investment, it can pull stunts such as usually avoiding a 2HKO from Jolly Dragonite's Outrage with Leftovers.

Kingambit.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out this page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Bulky Attacker
sets.description:
• Kingambit sets itself apart from most other Dark-types with its bulk and typing, which make it a reasonable check against Gholdengo that lack Focus Blast, and less vulnerable to Flutter Mane.

  • Guillotine: This makes Kingambit far more difficult to wall with foes such as Dondozo and Ting-Lu.

  • Brick Break versus Low Kick: Low Kick is Kingambit's best option against Tera Normal Dragonite and other Kingambit, but Brick Break is preferred because it deals far more damage to Chi-Yu.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Kingambit has a good typing, but its vulnerability to Fighting-type attacks or need to boost its power for late game sweeps means it benefits a lot from Terastallization.

  • Dark: A Dark Tera type makes Kingambit even harder to wall and removes its irritating Ground weakness, though powerful Fighting attacks can still be a problem,

  • Flying: This Tera type covers Kingambit's issues with Fighting- and Ground-type attacks very well and lets it deal big damage to Fighting-types like Annihilape and Great Tusk with Tera Blast.

  • Fairy: With a Fairy Tera type and Tera Blast, Kingambit improves its matchup against Chien-Pao and can deal serious damage to Iron Hands and Great Tusk, but it becomes vulnerable to Gholdengo.

Abilities

  • Supreme Overload: This ability makes Kingambit a deadly cleaner in late-game scenarios, and is generally the most consistent ability.

  • Defiant: Defiant prevents Kingambit from falling to Charm Flutter Mane, and is a good option for punishing speed control options like Rock Tomb.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 252 Atk / 148 Spe: This EV spread has enough Speed to outspeed most Corviknight and Skeledirge, and it still has enough bulk to survive one unboosted Body Press from Corviknight. Since this is a fairly congested Speed range, feel free to move some Attack EVs to Speed.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Using maximum Speed might seem absurd on such a slow Pokemon, but outspeeding most Skeledirge, Corviknight, and opposing Kingambit can make this worth it.

Items

  • Assault Vest: Kingambit's bulk is perfect for Assault Vest, letting it preform well against Flutter Mane and Iron Bundle.

  • Black Glasses: While its boost to Dark-type attacks isn't as high as Life Orb's, Black Glasses is a better fit for Kingambit's bulk due to the lack of recoil.

  • Sitrus Berry and 244 HP EVs: The burst of recovery helps Kingambit check Gholdengo better. Make sure to run 244 HP EVs to have an even HP stat. This will make Sitrus Berry activate after one use of Ruination.

sets.name: Stealth Rock Support
sets.description:
• Kingambit's excellent bulk and offensive presence make it a good, if unexpected, setter of Stealth Rock.

  • Brick Break versus Low Kick: While weak, Brick Break is the preferred fighting move for hitting Chi-Yu hard. Low Kick does more damage to Ting-Lu, other Kingambit and Tera Normal Dragonite.

  • Thunder Wave: Thunder Wave isn't a particularly common move on Kingambit, potentially letting it surprise some switch-ins like Iron Moth and Annihilape.

Other Options

  • Guillotine: With Guillotine, passive play from foes like Corviknight and Dondozo becomes far more risky.

  • Taunt: Taunt is effective at shutting down common support Pokemon such as Dondozo and Toxapex.

  • Tera Blast: Tera Fairy Blast is Kingambit's best shot against Iron Hands, one of its biggest checks. It also makes sense with Tera Flying to hit Great Tusk hard.

  • Metal Burst: If using Focus Sash, Metal Burst deals serious damage against a wide variety of leads.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Low: While Terastallization is fully viable, this Kingambit's focus on setting up Stealth Rock early means its not needed to function.

  • Flying: Tera Flying covers Kingambit's Fighting- and Ground-type weaknesses, making it do especially well against

  • Fairy: Tera Fairy can help prevent Iron Hands, one of the best Kingambit checks in the game, from OHKOing it.

  • Dark: When using Sucker Punch, Tera Dark gives Kingambit some late-game cleaning potential.

Items

Sitrus Berry: Sitrus Berry's quick burst of recovery keeps Kingambit more relevant in the later stages of the game. Make sure to use an even HP stat so that Ruination will activate Sitrus Berry.

  • Black Glasses: Kingambit's bulk and support options make Black Glasses a preferable option over Life Orb for more power, especially when using Sucker Punch.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash will let Kingambit survive even the strongest Fighting-type attacks, if Stealth Rock desperately needs to be set up.

  • Chople Berry: Chople Berry eases Kingambit's devastating Fighting-type weakness, though note powerful STAB users of Close Combat such as Iron Hands require massive Defense investment to survive. 252 HP and 12 Defense EVs can be used to survive Iron Valiant's Close Combat.

Abilities

  • Supreme Overlord: Even though this Kingambit is often set out early-game to set up Stealth Rock, Supreme Overlord gives it the flexibility to function later in the game if Stealth Rock isn't needed or if it manages to set up Stealth Rock without much harm to itself.

  • Defiant: Besides punishing the rare use of Intimidate, Defiant lets Kingambit defeat Charm Flutter Mane.

EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 252 Atk / 4 Def / 4 SpD / 4 Spe: This EV spread gives Kingambit an even HP stat, letting Sitrus Berry activate on the first use of Ruination.

  • 4 HP / 252 Atk / 252 Spe: Maximizing Speed lets Kingambit get the jump on opposing Kingambit and slower variants of Wo-Chien, Skeledirge, Corviknight, and Iron Hands.

Great Tusk.overview:
This analysis is for the Regulation C format of Battle Stadium Singles, which lasts until June 30th, 2023. For more information on this format and its current events, check out the format page!

If you feel this analysis is missing anything important or needs an update, feel free to suggest any changes here.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
• Great Tusk's primal physical prowess and great support options make it a good choice for a bulky Fighting-type.

  • Earthquake versus Headlong Rush: Headlong Rush's defensive drops and vulnerability to Rocky Helmet make it a riskier option than Earthquake, but the extra power OHKOes maximum HP Gholdengo.

  • Ice Spinner: This is highly recommended to avoid getting walled by Dragonite before it Terastallizes, while also dealing good damage to common Tera Flying Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Kingambit.

  • Rapid Spin: Great Tusk is one of the best Rapid Spin users, being able to take advantage of it offensively and heavily pressuring Ting-Lu to Terastallize or switch out.

  • Knock Off: Beyond the usefulness of removing items, this is Great Tusk's best move against Air Balloon Gholdengo.

Other Options

  • Rock Tomb: Rock Tomb is a good speed control option, great for breaking through Dragonite's Multiscale while nullifying its potential Speed boost, while letting other teammates take advantage of speed control. It also lets Great Tusk hit troublesome Focus Sash Ghost-types such as Flutter Mane and Gengar, something Rapid Spin can't do.

  • Iron Head: If using Tera Steel, Iron Head is a decent option for OHKOing Flutter Mane without using Headlong Rush, and it deals heavy damage to Baxcalibur and Tera Fairy Rotom-W.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Terastallization can help with Great Tusk's poor special bulk by resisting certain hits, but it works fine without it.

  • Steel: Tera Steel greatly aids against the many Fairy-, Ice-, and Flying-types that would otherwise prey on Great Tusk, such as Mimikyu, Iron Bundle, and Tera Flying Dragonite.

  • Water: Tera Water massively improves the matchup against Chien-Pao, and can let Great Tusk survive an encounter with offensive Iron Moth or Chi-Yu that lack Choice Specs.

  • Ground: The furious increase in power Tera Ground provides can be useful late game, giving Earthquake a high chance to OHKO even defensive Gholdengo and Headlong Rush the ability to 2HKO Terastallized Skeledirge.

  • Fighting: Not only does Tera Fighting improve the Chien-Pao matchup, but it OHKOs even the bulkiest Ting-Lu with Close Combat.

Items

  • Assault Vest: This patches up Great Tusk's poor Special Defense, which can be paired with the correct Tera Type to help against foes like Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, Iron Moth, and Chi-Yu.

  • Booster Energy: When saving Great Tusk for late-game sweeps, Booster Energy is preferred over Life Orb for preserving its HP against priority attacks.

  • Focus Sash: Focus Sash on such a bulky Pokemon may seem wasteful, but it vastly improves Great Tusk's matchups against special attackers such as Rotom-W and makes setting up Stealth Rock a far simpler task. If using Focus Sash, consider using the first alternate EV spread below.

Alternate EV Spreads

  • 4 HP / 12 Def / 236 Atk / 252 Spe with Jolly: This EV spread survives Adamant Focus Sash Meowscarada's Flower Trick followed by Sucker Punch, making it a good spread to use if using Focus Sash and Rapid Spin.

Assault Vest EV Spreads

  • All of these EV spreads will at least avoid a 2HKO from Modest Flutter Mane's Mystical Fire if using Tera Steel. If using a different Tera type, 16 Special Defense EVs can be redistributed.

  • 52 HP / 148 Atk / 4 Def / 164 SpD / 140 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom, and the rare Timid Abomasnow.

  • 4 HP / 44 Atk / 4 Def / 164 SpD / 244 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread is for Rapid Spin, outspeeding Iron Bundle after a Speed boost.

sets.name: Bulk Up
sets.description:
• Great Tusk's fantastic Defense stat makes it a great option for setting up Bulk Up late-game.

  • Taunt versus Substitute: Taunt preys on defensive Pokemon such as Wo-Chien and Corviknight, while Substitute protects Great Tusk from Garganacl's Salt Cure. Dragon Tail from Garchomp and Dragonite, and OHKO moves from the likes of Dondozo and Kingambit.

  • Ice Spinner: Dragonite is such a problematic foe that hitting it hard is worth more than a Fighting-type STAB move.

Other Options

  • Body Press: Although it is difficult to fit in without sacrificing utility or coverage, Body Press is a reasonable option if a Fighting-type STAB move is needed.

  • Close Combat: Close Combat does not gel well with the defensive nature of this set, but it deals far more damage to Ting-Lu than any of Great Tusk's other options.

Tera Types

  • Tera Dependency - Medium: Great Tusk is a good bulky sweeper on its own, but Terstallization makes it far more difficult to revenge kill.

  • Water: Not only is Tera Water an excellent option against Chien-Pao and Chi-Yu, but it also means Dondozo will never break Great Tusk's Substitute with Wave Crash, and Assault Vest Azumarill become an easy target to set up on.

  • Steel: Tera Steel is a great option for dealing with Great Tusk's weaknesses, such as Fairy-types and makes Iron Bundle usually fail to 2HKO specially defensive Great Tusk without Choice Specs.

  • Poison: Tera Poison is a decent alternative to Tera Steel, providing the vital Fairy-type resistance without the weaknesses to Fighting- and Fire-type attacks and an extremely useful immunity to being poisoned that eases the match-up against Toxic Spikes foes such as Clodsire and Meowscarada.

  • Fire: Fire is not a great defensive type; however, not only does it do well against Fairy-types such as Flutter Mane, it also protects Great Tusk from fast Will-O-Wisp users such as Dragapult, Mimikyu, and Volcarona.

Items

  • Leftovers: The residual recovery from Leftovers best suits the slow set-up of this set, especially if using Substitute.

  • Booster Energy: Depending on the EV spread, Booster Energy can boost Attack or Speed to increase Great Tusk's late-game cleaning potential.

  • Covert Cloak: If a Garganacl check is desperately needed, Covert Cloak Great Tusk is up for the task.

EV Spreads

  • 188 HP / 140 Atk / 4 Def / 36 SpD / 140 Spe with Adamant: This EV spread outspeeds Adamant Breloom and the rare Timid Abomasnow, survives Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry, and has a very good chance of avoiding a 2HKO from Adamant Azumarill after using Bulk Up. The Attack EVs OHKO Chien-Pao and defensive Gholdengo with Earthquake after Bulk Up.

  • 4 HP / 252 SpD / 252 Spe with Jolly: This spread gains a Speed boost from Protosynthesis, making Great Tusk an even better late-game sweeper at the cost of physical bulk.

  • 244 HP / 20 Atk / 84 Def / 20 SpD / 140 Spe with Impish: This EV spread is meant for use with Tera Steel or Tera Poison, maintaining Great Tusk's Substitute against Dondozo's Wave Crash after Terastallization. It also outspeeds Adamant Breloom and the rare Timid Abomasnow, and survives Timid Iron Bundle's Freeze-Dry.

  • 252 HP / 4 Atk / 252 SpD with Careful: Maximum investment in special bulk makes Great Tusk much more difficult to revenge kill with the likes of Gholdengo and Iron Bundle. The 4 Attack EVs gives an Attack boost from Protosynthesis, which is preferred for improving the Skeledirge matchup and sweeping more easily.

sets.name: Choice Item
sets.description:
• Great Tusk's high power attacks make it a fine Choice item holder.

  • Headlong Rush versus Earthquake: Headlong Rush is preferred for stampeding over maximum HP Gholdengo, but Earthquake avoids chip damage from Rocky Helmet and makes Great Tusk far less vulnerable to priority attacks from foes like Dragonite, Chien-Pao, and Palafin-H.

  • Ice Spinner: Great Tusk should never leave its cave without a move to hit Dragonite hard!

  • Knock Off: Knock Off deals massive damage to Air Balloon Gholdengo and is almost guaranteed to OHKO offensive Dragapult after Stealth Rock damage.

  • Jolly versus Adamant: A Jolly nature ensures that Great Tusk outspeeds Gholdengo, and Choice Scarf variants outspeed Dragapult. Adamant is still a reasonable option for more power since Great Tusk will still outpace Breloom, and if using Choice Scarf, Iron Bundle, Flutter Mane, and Chien-Pao.

Other Options
